page.title: 05Transport in Haltwhistle
page.content: Haltwhistle has a railway station on the Newcastle to Carlisle line with 26 trains each day. The busiest weekday train is the 8.24 which carries Haltwhistle children to Haydon Bridge High School. Adults use the train to travel to work and on Saturdays to travel to larger shopping centres. There is an hourly bus service between Newcastle and Carlisle which travels along the A69 calling in at all the small villages on its route. In the summer months a limited bus service travels from Hexham along the Military Road to Haltwhistle for the benefit of tourists wishing to visit the Roman Wall. All of these services are subsidised and are under threat of cuts. The majority of local people find a car is essential as public services are limited and expensive.
